channel.title: Latest PHMSA Hazardous Materials Incident Reports, for PA
channel.description: The latest Form 5800.1 hazardous material reports submitted to the Department of Transportation and posted online by the Pipeline and Hazardous Materials Safety Administration, for PA

item.title: Report E-2023100486
item.description:
Report E-2023100486

Identified by scraper @ 2023-10-19T15:12:03+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-10-10
  • City: DOWNINGTOWN
  • State: PA
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: QUALITY CARRIERS, INC.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: DURING UNLOADING OPERATION CONSIGNEE EMPLOYEES CONECTED HOSE TO STORAGE TANK THAT DID NOT HAVE THE CAPICITY FOR THE LOAD. STORAGE TANK HIGH LEVEL CENSOR FAILED TO OPERATE RESULTING IN OVERFILL OF THE STORAGE TANK. CONSIGNEE HAULTED OPERATION AND CONNECTED UNLOADING HOSE TO A SECONDARY STORAGE TANK TO COMPLETE UNLOADING. PLANT PERSONNEL CLEANED UP RELEASED MATERIAL FROM TANK AREA.

  • Carrier/Reporter: XPO LOGISTICS FREIGHT, INC.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: During off loading the warehouse crew accidentally put a forklift fork into one case of trufuel 50 fuel (un1203) damaging one of the inner metal 1 gallon can and releasing 1 gallon of product. Contractors were dispatched for the containment and cleanup of the release.

  • Description: During off loading it was discovered that the load had shifted during transit and that the one case of printing ink (un1210) had been crushed and that 4 of the inner poly 25 ounce cartridges had released 1 cup of product. The warehouse crew was able to contain and cleanup the release, so no contractors were dispatched.

item.title: Report X-2023091004
item.description:
Report X-2023091004

Identified by scraper @ 2023-10-20T18:13:54+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-09-19
  • City: NORTHAMPTON
  • State: PA
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: Fedex Ground Package System, Inc.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: SequenceEvent: QA was called to go up to Primary for a leaking hazmat. The hazmat package was sent up on the overhead belt instead of treating it as a NC. I put on proper PPE and brought a red tote to contain the white powder leaking out from the box. DescribePack: The lid wasn't fully closed. DurationRel: 1 and MitigateEffect: Moved into a bag lined tote then into a sealed drum.

  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: SequenceEvent: Package may have been dropped DescribePack: bottom of 1 Gallon can of TZ33 Thinner Blend dented and leaking into plastic bag. Box wet and smells of thinner DurationRel: 1 and MitigateEffect: Package put in plastic bag and into red hazmat bin

item.title: Report X-2023090968
item.description:
Report X-2023090968

Identified by scraper @ 2023-10-20T18:13:54+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-09-19
  • City: MIDDLETOWN
  • State: PA
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: Fedex Ground Package System, Inc.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: SequenceEvent: Shipment taken out of system flow due to external carton wet. Upon inspection of inner contents 4 X 1 quarts Steris Spor-Klenz concentrate. 1 X 1 quart Spor-Klenz concentrate had a loose cap allowing .10 quarts to release. The other 3 X 1 quart plastic bottles of Spor-Klenz concentrate were not damaged. All bottles were in a separate plastic bag and there was cardboard inside to secure the plastic bottles. No absorbent or slotted partitions were found. Facility procedures for damaged hazardous materials followed. Contents contained and awaiting disposition. DescribePack: 1 out of 4 plastic bottles had a loose cap leaking .10 quarts of Spor-klenz concentrate. DurationRel: 1 and MitigateEffect: Package was placed inside a hazmat bag lined red tote.

item.title: Report X-2023090951
item.description:
Report X-2023090951

Identified by scraper @ 2023-10-19T15:12:03+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-09-18
  • City: EXTON
  • State: PA
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: Fedex Ground Package System, Inc.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: SequenceEvent: pkg was found on the dock. box was wet and falling apart. box and contents were placed in a bin and put in the hazmat cage. DescribePack: two caps were loose. pkg was likely on its side. both conditions contributed to the leak DurationRel: 1 and MitigateEffect: box and contents were placed in a bin and put in the hazmat cage. unsure of where the leak occured as there was no visible liquid anywhere near the pkg.

item.title: Report X-2023090900
item.description:
Report X-2023090900

Identified by scraper @ 2023-10-18T15:12:15+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-09-15
  • City: PHILADELPHIA
  • State: PA
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: Fedex Ground Package System, Inc.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: 1. X-2023090900 SequenceEvent: The package was being loaded onto a track when the package handler noticed that one of the corners of the box was wet. The box was open by QA and they saw that one of the bottles caps were loose causing liquid to leak out the side of the bottle. DescribePack: The cap become loose on one of the bottles. DurationRel: 1 and MitigateEffect: The hazmat was placed in a bin and put into the damage hazmat cage. 2. X-2023100117 SequenceEvent: The package was being loaded onto a truck when the package handler noticed that the box was wet of the side. QA check the package and saw that one of the bottles caps became loose causing liquid to leak on the box and the other bottle in the box. DescribePack: One of the bottles caps was loose. DurationRel: 1 and MitigateEffect: The package was put in a bin and placed into the damage hazmat cage.

item.title: Report X-2023090858
item.description:
Report X-2023090858

Identified by scraper @ 2023-10-18T15:12:15+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-09-15
  • City: FAIRVIEW
  • State: PA
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: Fedex Ground Package System, Inc.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: SequenceEvent: The box was found on the rollers in the unload area. The box had a wet spot on the side. Taken to QA to inspect. DescribePack: The side of the box had a wet spot. When inspecting package found wet spots inside box and the lid was loose on the jug. DurationRel: 1 and MitigateEffect: The box was brought to QA to inspect. Box was placed with orientation arrows upright. When inspected found liquid had leaked from the lid. Lid was tightened to stop leakage.

item.title: Report X-2023080912
item.description:
Report X-2023080912

Identified by scraper @ 2023-10-24T00:32:30+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-07-17
  • City: Plymouth Meeting
  • State: PA
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Rail
  • Carrier/Reporter: NORFOLK SOUTHERN RAILWAY COMPANY
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: On July 17th at 0430 a CSX train operating on Norfolk Southern tracks went over sink hole resulting in 16 railcars to derail with no release. Local authorities responded and evacuated nearby residence until SHPX 220652 could be confirmed no releases. Once confirmed no releases evacuation was lifted. The report is being submitted for the evacuation only.
